post_text: The most recent State Guidance has come out. Riddle School District can open in person from grades K-3. If you are uncomfortable sending your K-3 student to school, please let us know at registration (August 17 and 18) and alternative learning options will be provided. Grades 4-12 will be through distance learning and will be more comprehensive than last spring. Daily attendance will be required, and grades will be traditional letter scale. The State has allowed us to do some limited, in-person instruction for students with critical needs, in small cohorts, for a limited time each week. We will be delaying the start of school until September 14th so that our staff can get everything set up. We will be reviewing our status monthly to determine if in-person re-opening is possible. Please understand that an outbreak in the area or in the schools could force us to convert to Distance Learning K-12. We are working out the details now and will update you as our plans are approved.

The fee for students 15 to 17 is $199 (or $124 for students who qualify for free/reduced fee lunch). The fee for students with a license or over age 18 is $379. The class fee includes books. Students must have their Oregon permit before class starts. Parent(s)/guardian(s) must attend the first night of the driver training class. This is a wonderful opportunity for our students. A minimum number of participating students is required. Sign up soon!

post_text: Riddle School District was recently informed of some Riddle Elementary School students who were diagnosed with Hand, Foot, and Mouth Disease (HFMD). Attached find an infographic about the disease, a letter from our superintendent, and a FACT sheet with basics of the disease. If your child has a fever or active blistering, please keep your child at home and seek medical attention as necessary. According to the CDC, HFMD is usually not serious, and nearly all people recover in 7 to 10 days. Young children are primarily affected by HFMD, but it may be seen in adults. Please remember to "cover" when coughing and wash hands frequently and appropriately.
